meanings.definition: A person or thing that yawns.
meanings.sent1: The baby was one of the yawners in the room.
meanings.sent2: The zoo was full of yawners after a long day.
meanings.sent3: The yawners in the library were all reading the same book.
meanings.sent4: The yawners in the audience made the comedian work harder.
meanings.sent5: The classroom was full of yawners after a late night.

meanings.definition: Something that causes boredom or lack of interest.
meanings.sent1: The long speeches were real yawners for the audience.
meanings.sent2: The textbook was full of yawners, making studying difficult.
meanings.sent3: The movie turned out to be a real yawner, putting everyone to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The meeting was a yawner, with nothing interesting discussed.
meanings.sent5: The lecture on history was a real yawner, with no excitement at all.
